Chapter Three What a lucky streak [he]352-he ’d been on the past two years . First [Danica]51-danica ’s betrayal , then [[his]352-he father]192-his father ’s death , now this . The icing on the biggest fucking cake of [his]352-he life . [[His]352-he father]192-his father would ’ve said [he]352-he ’d brought it upon [himself]352-he . But then again , [[his]352-he father]192-his father had always been [a huge bastard]354-a huge bastard . [He]192-his father ’d disapproved of everything that [Logan]175-logan had ever touched . Not a stretch to think that [he]192-his father ’d have disapproved of [Logan]175-logan ’s latest acquisition . It had seemed like a simple task . Epilogue It did n’t take long for [Brontë]112-brontë to decide what [she]1422-i wanted to do with [her]1422-i life . [Gretchen]365-gretchen ’s book donation charity had inspired [her]365-gretchen , and after signing up for continuing education classes at [NYU]43-nyu , [she]365-gretchen worked with [[Logan]175-logan ’s financial advisors]1424-logan ’s financial advisors to set up a charity . Philosophy Reads was soon born , complete with a fancy website and nonprofit status . [Her]365-gretchen goal ? To bring [her]365-gretchen love of reading and knowledge to those who could n’t afford it or could n’t get out . Brontë selected two books — one classic and one modern — and then purchased hundreds of copies . These [she]365-gretchen had delivered to [local libraries]1425-local libraries , [retirement homes]1426-retirement homes , and [hospitals]1427-hospitals , and [she]365-gretchen set up weekly meetings for [people]166-people to meet and discuss [them]166-people . [She]365-gretchen nearly danced with delight when [her]365-gretchen first meeting — at [the retirement home where [Gretchen]365-gretchen had dropped off books before]1429-the retirement home where gretchen had dropped off books before — had an attendance of [nearly fifty people]1430-nearly fifty people , all of [them]1430-nearly fifty people brimming with enthusiasm to discuss that month ’s reads , [The Iliad]159-the iliad and [Harry Potter]160-harry potter and [the Sorcerer]161-the sorcerer ’s Stone . [She]365-gretchen wanted to eventually introduce [them]1430-nearly fifty people to heavier reads , but [she]365-gretchen ’d start [them]1430-nearly fifty people out slow . The discussions were a success in [some venues]1431-some venues , and in others , not as much — [she]365-gretchen had a few that were sparsely attended . But it was a work in progress , and [she]365-gretchen was determined to fine - tune [her]365-gretchen charity and turn it into a well - oiled machine that would help bring the joy of reading to [those who might otherwise overlook it]1432-those who might otherwise overlook it . That part of [her]365-gretchen life had become incredibly satisfying — almost as much as living with [Logan]175-logan . As soon as [she]365-gretchen ’d moved back in , [she]365-gretchen ’d quietly begun to refill [[his]175-logan library]2231-his library with new reads — some classics , which [Logan]175-logan read out a sense of obligation to [her]365-gretchen , but when [she]365-gretchen caught [him]175-logan quietly reading a Tom Clancy paperback , [she]365-gretchen also added [men]169-men ’s action thrillers to [his]175-logan section and even read some of them [herself]365-gretchen so [they]169-men could discuss the books over dinner . [Logan]175-logan was proud of [her]365-gretchen charity , and never objected to the amount of money [she]365-gretchen spent . At night [they]169-men twined around each other , locked in bliss . [She]365-gretchen ’d signed the nondisclosure agreement without a word of complaint and had offered to sign a prenup . [Logan]175-logan turned down [her]365-gretchen offer vehemently and then spent the evening kissing [her]365-gretchen back into submission . The fact that [she]365-gretchen was willing , [he]175-logan told [her]365-gretchen , was more than enough for [him]175-logan . Life was just about perfect for Brontë , and [she]365-gretchen grew to love [Logan]175-logan more each day . Every morning , [she]365-gretchen woke up eager for what the day would bring and excited about how much [she]365-gretchen enjoyed being with [Logan]175-logan . And every day [she]365-gretchen held [her]365-gretchen engagement ring — that big , audacious diamond [she]365-gretchen would have run from a few months prior — and read the heart - melting inscription to [herself]365-gretchen again . Every heart sings a song , incomplete , until another heart whispers back . And [Brontë]112-brontë ’s heart was complete now that [Logan]175-logan ’s was whispering back .
